title: Out of the Deep I Call

author.name: Henry W. Baker
author.bio: Henry Williams Baker was an English hymn writer and Anglican clergyman. He is best known for his work on 'Hymns Ancient and Modern,' a landmark hymnal. His hymn 'Out of the Deep I Call' reflects a profound sense of penitence and plea for divine mercy.

lyrics:
Out of the deep I call,
To Thee O Lord to Thee,
Before Thy throne
Of Grace I fall,
Be merciful to me.

Out of the deep I cry
The woeful deep of sin,
Of evil done
In days gone by,
Of evil now within.

Out of the deep of fear,
And dread of coming shame,
From morning watch
Till night is near,
I plead the precious name.

Lord there is mercy now,
As ever was with Thee,
Before Thy throne
Of grace I bow,
Be merciful to me.
